content: This article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Kampong Ubi Constituency" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(January 2022)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Kampong Ubi Single Member Constituency** was a constituency in Singapore. It existed from 1968 to 1988 and was merged in 1988 to [Aljunied Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Aljunied_Group_Representation_Constituency). It carved out of [Geylang Serai Constituency](/wiki/Geylang_Serai_Constituency). ## Member of Parliament **Election****Member of Parliament****Party****1968**Yaacob bin Mohamed[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**1972****1976****1980****1984** ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1960s [General Election 1968](/wiki/1968_Singaporean_general_election): Kampong Ubi PartyCandidateVotes%**[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)****Yaacob bin Mohamed** **9,797** **81.87** [Independent](/wiki/Independent_(politician))Tay Mook Yong2,16918.13Majority7,62863.74[Registered electors](/wiki/Voter_registration)13,434[Turnout](/wiki/Voter_turnout)11,96689.07[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) **win** (new seat) This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Kampong Ubi Constituency
